Key Match Events: Szoboszlai scored a penalty in the 48th minute to give Hungary the lead
Akaydin scored for Turkey in the 57th minute
Nagy and Kleinheisler were given yellow cards in the 86th and 90+6th minutes respectively
Pre-Game Insights: Hungary have impressed on home soil during a period when Turkey have looked strong on the road
Considering there is little to separate these two nations, a score draw may be on the cards in Budapest
Hungary have not lost any of their last seven matches on their own turf
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Puskas Arena in Budapest
The two teams meet for the first time since November 2020 when Hungary secured a 2-0 home victory in the UEFA Nations League
Others: Hungary and Turkey qualified for Euro 2024 as group winners
Hungary sealed qualification to their third Euros in a row after finishing top of Group G in Euro 2024 qualifying
